file_content.text: Rumor is, those Killiks come as big as a troop carrier. Not sure I believe it.
The Brood Totem works. It lured the Killiks to the Organa forces.
The science boys'll be happy. Me, I hope it means we go back to killing aliens instead of baiting them.
It's been a pleasure to see you in action. You ever need a hive extraction team or a couple tonnes of xenotoxic torpedoes, you give the Bughunters a call.
You manage to retrieve that attractor tech and deploy it near the Organas, give us the word.
Well, you're the team that carved through half of Balmorra!
Well, look who's here. You're the Sith who carved through half of Balmorra!
Well, if it isn't the mercenary from Balmorra. I remember your work.
You're the mystery troubleshooter from Balmorra--you may execute me for saying so, but I admire your work.
Sergeant Namada, Bughunter Division. My squad came here off Colicoid duty--it's an honor to meet you.
Bughunter Division?
Special Tactics Group 41-Delta. Geonosians, Gand, Verpine--if it's got eggs and an exoskeleton, we know how to kill it.
Tell me--how does the battle proceed?
Report, Sergeant.
I'm sure you're a fine, devoted servant of the Empire.
How very polite, Sergeant.
Ah--yes, my lord. Thank you.
It's my pleasure, Sergeant--but officially, I'm not even here.
Just don't mention we met.
Then consider this my unofficial report.
Gets a little old, talking to officers and royalty.
Good to meet the grunts.
I'll take your word for it--don't much get the privilege.
You're an idiot.
Begging your pardon. I'll get to our status, then, assuming you're interested.
Team's supposed to contain the Killik threat so House Thul's free to work.
Fine plan, but Science Bureau has us trying out attractor tech--like this "Brood Totem" device they gave us. Lures Killiks into enemy territory.
While you're fighting Killiks, the scientists are trying to study them.
Complicating your job?
They talk to the Moff and he gives the orders.
An impressive device.
Got green lights, smells like iron, makes a high-pitched chittering sound--like what a droid would build if he worshipped roaches.
That's bound to go wrong.
We agree in that. Not my opinion that matters, I'm afraid.
We dropped the totem off in Killik territory so it could "synchronize pheromones." We barely survived; now we need to move it to Organa territory for testing.
We carry chitin-piercing rounds and insecticide gas--we can't fight Organa troops. But you assist like on Balmorra, this lure project might move forward.
I think I can help.
What are you offering?
We've hired mercenaries before--cheap ones make the best bait, but the funds are there. Grab the device, get to Organa, test it out.
So long as there's mayhem.
You'd have to slaughter Killiks on the way to the device, get it near Organa troops and see if the lure works. Dangerous enough?
Just be careful you don't lure in too many Killiks. They're not like Colicoids--they take prisoners and... well, better not to know.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Understood. We've got some new xenotoxic flechettes; they worked on the Verpines, maybe they'll work on Killiks.
Men, check your loadouts--we'll be seeing more Killiks tonight.
